Facing the Truth

Dimly lit room, tension rising between siblings.  
Raskolnikov: “I am a contemptible person, Dounia.”  

Dounia: “A contemptible person, but ready to face suffering!”  

Raskolnikov: “Yes, I thought of drowning myself.”  

Dounia: “Pride, Rodya.”  

---

Room filled with silence, anguish palpable.  
Raskolnikov: “I’m going to give myself up.”  

Dounia: “You are crying, sister, but can you hold out your hand?”  

Dounia: “Aren’t you half expiating your crime?”  

Raskolnikov: “What crime?”  

Dounia: “The one you must face.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with his feelings of contemptibility and pride as he prepares to face the consequences of his actions.
